column4: bizzle: can you help me with Nvidia GTX 280 driver installation?
There's a front end for it, check synaptic and search for nvidia
It's blizzle.. try typing blizz <tab> And you want envyng-qt
sorry I'm in low graphic mode right now because ubuntu wont load properly. I can barely read the chat
No worries, it's just hard to see your responses when my name's not highlighted.
is there a faster way to download this? it's going between 20-40kb/s
Um, what are you downloading again, and from where? If it's an official repository, you might want to open Synaptic and select repositories, and do a test for the fastest one.
I tried installing the nvidia drivers from the nvidia website but during installation it said something about Xen kernal not being supported or something... what does that mean?
Xen is a hypervisor. How that pertains to nvidia's drivers I know not :/
well installed the recommended driver... wish me luck time for a reboot
the Drivers are working but when I try to save a resolution change in the Nvidia x server settings app I get, "Failed to parse existing X config file /etc/X11/xorg.conf"
Check your xorg.conf file for syntax issues, perhaps.
again.. kinda new here :D How do I do that?
how do I check my xorg.conf file for syntax issues
This is the point in the conversation where I hand you over to google :)
